page.title: 02HOLY TRINITY CHURCH, WESTON
page.content: {Holy Trinity Church}is on the outskirts of Weston but it is in the centre of the Parish. You can only get to the Chuch in a car up a narrow lane leading up from Weston_Walkern road. The Church is surrounded by a pleasant Churchyard. In{1086}there were{two {Parish priests}but there was no sign of a church.{We now have one vicar}but he works half time for Weston and half time for Baldock Parish. The{North {Transept}is the oldest part of the Church and it was built in the{Norman times. The centre arches are also Norman. The six bells are in the Church tower are three hundred years old. The actual date can be checked by the inscriptions on the bells. In the churchyard is the grave of{Jack O'Legs The grave stones are set fourteen feet apart, stepped out by a former church warden !
